In 2018, nearly 40M Americans participated in SNAP, w/monthly per-person benefits averaging ~$127/month. But @BLS_gov figures say the average American consumer spends $7,729 annually on food – ~$644/month. That’s a difference of almost $520/month.   https://www.bls.gov/news.release/cesan.nr0.htm … https://twitter.com/hamiltonproj/status/1137783933649727488 …

So…happy #MomsEqualPayDay? #EqualPay

The more you know: this 2017 @nberpubs paper outlines long-term trends and research evidence on women, work and family in the past 50 years. #EqualPayAct #MomsEqualPay #TeachEcon  https://www.nber.org/papers/w23644
This 2016 paper in the Journal of Economic Literature provides more empirical evidence of the gender wage gap. #EqualPayAct #MomsEqualPay #TeachEcon  https://www.nber.org/papers/w21913

“Bosses and colleagues tend to perceive women as less competent after they have children, and mothers suffer an average four percent pay cut per child.” https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/united-states/2019-05-08/mind-gap?fbclid=IwAR0xTr28jkS1nttWcdGUckG2UWJe6hz5T4KHH7U9oxrGQIGS99N_gG_1NYQ …

“The lifetime costs of childbearing, especially early childbearing, are particularly high for skilled women. These differential costs of childbearing may account for the far greater tendency of high-skill women to delay or avoid childbearing altogether.”  https://www.nber.org/papers/w16582

The child penalties “are transmitted through generations, from parents to daughters (but not sons), consistent with an influence of childhood environment in the formation of women’s preferences over family and career.” #MomsEqualPay  https://www.nber.org/papers/w24219  pic.twitter.com/xxIkLx7ji8

“The fraction of gender inequality [in earnings] caused by child penalties has increased dramatically over time, from about 40% in 1980 to about 80% in 2013.” #MomsEqualPay  https://www.nber.org/papers/w24219  pic.twitter.com/hh2bUu9zKg
Looking for some reading on #MomsEqualPayDay? Here are some papers from @nberpubs. Heads up, it’s a little depressing.

Men & women aren’t paid equally – despite passage of the #EqualPayAct 56 years ago. The same applies to mothers & fathers. 

Moms would have to work 525 days to earn what the average white dad earns in a year. 

Today is 525 days since 1/1/18, making it #MomsEqualPayDay

SEC enforcement activity fell precipitously during the first 20 months of Trump’s presidency. There was a 62% drop in imposed penalties and orders demanding returned profits compared to the final 20 months of the Obama administration. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/03/us/trump-sec-doj-corporate-penalties.html …
Under Trump, the SEC’s enforcement actions have been drastically curtailed, and the agency has lost 10% of its employees over the past two years.
Today is the 85th anniversary of the creation of the SEC, which was designed to ensure trust and transparency in securities markets.

OUT TODAY: American exports & imports both fell in April, and the overall trade deficit for goods/services shrank by $1.1B to $50.8B, @BEA_News & @uscensusbureau reported. Our deficit for goods with China grew $2.1B to $29.4B while our deficits with Mexico & Canada both shrank.

In January 1948 (just after the “Rosie the Riveter” era), Women’s Civilian Labor Force Participation Rate was 32%. 

In April 2000, it hit a peak of 60.3%; currently, women’s LFPR stands at 57.1% as of April 2019. #DDay
 https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/LNS11300002 … https://www.msnbc.com/andrea-mitchell-reports/watch/real-life-rosie-the-riveters-talk-75th-anniversary-of-d-day-61368389503 …
